Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR.Text: *: Welcome to Edina, where lineage is law, and manners maketh man!
*: Bumpkins, boors and yokels, turn ye, and begone from this place!
*: Golly, have you heard? They say those three boulders down in the dungeon do something bleeding marvellous if you line them up on the blue floor panels!
*: And if you get in a muddle, you just pop outside, and they rearrange the lot while you're gone! How jolly decent of them!

*: ♪ Ohhh, a simpleton serf from the ends of the earth...
Shall save us despite their most ignoble birth! ♪
*: ...Hm? You are the serf in question? Eurgh! I see the rumours of your ignoble birth were entirely accurate!

*: ♪ Ohhh, the sun in the trees and the birds on the wing...
The toil in the fields and the joy that it brings! ♪
*: (sigh) Now that one comes to think of it, one does rather miss one's village... Oh, for one's long-lost bumpkin boyhood!
*: I say, I've heard rather a smashing rumour! Do you want to hear it? Well...they say the ultimate key is in a shrine somewhere! Don't tell, will you?
*: Well now, yours isn't a face I've seen about the place. Traveller, eh?
*: Ho ho! I rather thought you might be! After all, dressed like that, what else could you be but a wandering rustic?
*: Oh come, now. There's no use lying to me<--->I'd know the mud-spattered rags of a wandering rustic anywhere!
*: Don't think you can come here and get ideas above your station! We've good noses for real quality round these parts!
*: Golly, one really struggles to keep one's eyes open on these evening...(yawn)...shifts... Zzzzzzz...

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_Out_SUB_0_VOLUM.Text: {LEADER} calms the monster with a soothing voice and tells it about Monty's monster menagerie...

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR.Text:
*: ♪ Ohhh, if I could turn invisible for but a while...
My face would be adorned by a stunning smile! ♪
*: Ah, didn't see you there. I am but a humble bard who travels far and wide searching for inspiration to write glorious new ballads...
*: As it happens, I recently heard tell of some kind of herb that allows one to turn oneself invisible.
*: I was so inspired by the mystery of it all that I made it into a song!
*: It was little more than a rumour I fear, but a chap once told me this herb that turns one invisible could be purchased from a merchant in some backwater.
*: Why, if I could obtain it myself I could sneak right into this castle. Just think of all the marvellous ballads such an exciting intrusion could inspire...

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_Out_SUB_0_VOLUM.Text: *: In case you were wondering: yes, that is how they treat all outsiders here.
*: I myself heard tell of this peculiar place whilst in Portoga, and came in the hope that it might inspire my next masterpiece.

*: Ohhh, if I could turn invisible for but a while...
My face would be adorned by a stunning smile!
*: Oh, yes. I was just recalling this herb I heard of that allows one to turn oneself invisible. Supposedly, it can be found in some place where heroes' bravery is tested.
*: I was so inspired by the mystery of it all that I had been attempting to turn it into a poem or song.
*: Perhaps I should start by working out exactly which backwater it is found in, that I might make a ballad based on it! Oh yes, that sounds positively splendid...

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_.Text: *: Now, now... I think that's quite enough patrolling the palace halls for one day. Time for a little beauty sleep... Ahhmmm...
*: By crikey, I'm about ready to fall asleep on the bally spot! (yawn)
*: The king, you say? Straight up the stairs, and no dawdling!
*: Zzz... Zzz...
*: I haven't the foggiest why, but the Chancellor sent me packing from upstairs with a flea in my ear...
*: One can only imagine what he might be up to...
*: I've been hearing tell of a jolly rum piece of pottery that can swallow up vast swathes of the sea! Fancy that!
*: What's that you say? Here in the castle? Well, I'll be dashed...
*: What's that you say? This is the very pot in question? Well, I'll be dashed...
*: Taking the night air, are we? A capital idea! May I recommend the balcony upstairs? It's marvellously bracing of an evening.
*: Goddess bless you, my...decidedly humble child.
*: Zzz... Zzz...
*: The rather imposing lady stood over by the pond there is Her Majesty, Margot, Right-Honourable Princess of the Realm.
*: This is the royal bedchamber. You're not allowed in here!
*: I'm afraid Their Majesties have already retired for the evening. I can't let you in. It's more than my job's worth!
*: Have you heard all this talk about the shrine that sank under the sea? It's just off the shore somewhere or other near a sort of rocky mass in the ocean...
*: I heard there's some kind of treasure down there. Ooh, it gets your mind racing, doesn't it?
*: Being cooped up in a castle like this is a real ordeal for travellers like us, eh?
*: Especially when they won't stop going on about how vulgar and low-born we all are...
Oh, hello! We've heard all sorts of interesting things about you! One has never seen a commoner up close... Hmm... How...quaint!
You must have some awfully precious tales of the dolorous travails of the Great Unwashed to tell. You simply must let me hear them!
Ah-phew... Get away from me...commoner! What is a commoner, anyway...? Ah-phew...
Ho ho...zzz...ho... You work-shy bumpkin... Zzz...
*: Mm nm nm nm...

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_1F_SUB_0_VOLUME.Text: {LEADER} calms the monster with a soothing voice and tells it about Monty's monster menagerie...

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_.Text: *: It's a rum thing, but I get the inkling monsters have infiltrated the castle... But how does one go about driving the blighters out?
*: I can sense them throughout the whole jolly day! I know they're here, but I've seen neither hide nor hair of a single one... Where could they be hiding?
*: It's a rum thing, but I get the inkling monsters have infiltrated the castle... But how does one go about driving the blighters out?
*: I know they're here, but I've seen neither hide nor hair of a single one... Where could they be hiding?
*: Until just the other day, I had the extraordinary feeling that monsters walked among us in the castle, but now...nothing!
*: Perhaps it was all just the stress of castle life. I do wonder if a country bumpkin like me will ever get used to it here...

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_.Text: *: The king is a jolly generous sort, you know. Why, he doesn't balk in the slightest at having to talk to the likes of you.
*: Do mind your p's and q's with His Majesty now, won't you?
We have been hearing tell of a new world way off over the seas to the west. It seems it is home to a long-suffering encampment of settlers known as Persistence.
Oh, uh... Haha... You<---> I<---> It seems you caught me at rather an...unfortunate juncture... Ahaha!
I wonder if you might do me the favour of, uh...never mentioning this to another living soul?
In return, a word of advice: on the coast of the continent to the west sits a small meadow surrounded by forest.
Pay it a visit. You will not regret it...
I am a generous and kind-hearted king. See, I even deign to converse with the likes of you!
Take the castle depths, for instance, where one might happen upon three boulders. Their deeper meaning is no doubt lost on <IfSolo(a bumpkin such as yourself,bumpkins such as yourselves)>.
Though you need not feel vexed! Even the most erudite minds of Edina have been unable to solve this mystery, and they have been grappling with it ever since my father graced the throne.
Frankly, I myself find the whole room rather rum too, and if I cannot solve its mystery, then doubtless no one can! Bahahaha!
I am a generous and kind-hearted king. See, I even deign to converse with the likes of you!
Oh? You seek to learn about a <6>bottomless pot<9>?
Hmm, yes, my grandfather once spoke of such an object. Allow me a moment to cast my mind back...
I remember he said something about a rocky mass in the sea, too small to be called an islet, that was a good distance from the shore.
Alas, more than that I cannot recall. Clearly it was not a matter of any real import! Bahahaha!
I am a generous and kind-hearted king. See, I even deign to converse with the likes of you!
Tell me, humble <IfSolo(peasant,peasants)>, are you familiar with the landmark known as Olivia's Promontory?
Sailors speak of ships unable to traverse the strait found near the promontory. It matters not how windy the weather is, all boats remain becalmed.
It may be located in a somewhat...rustic region, but it still makes for a fascinating story!
If one were to travel a good distance north from the provincial town of Baharata, one would happen upon a quaint hovel. That, I am told, is how travellers know they have reached Olivia's Promontory.
I am a generous and kind-hearted king. See, I even deign to converse with the likes of you!
Ah, I cannot tell you just how splendid it feels to rule over the most prosperous kingdom in the land! Bahahaha!

Txt_Talk_Edinbear_Castle_B1FB_TreasurBox.Text: There appears to be a letter stuffed into the bottomless pot.
<6>I s'pose if y'all are readin' this here letter, you must've got your mitts on the bottomless pot.
<6>It's been in Persistence now for, well, who knows how long. But I thought it was high time someone wrote down what it's for.
<6>Now, if you wanna see what this baby can do, you'll need to mosey on over to this rocky reef in the ocean. It's to the north of an itsy-bitsy gap between the capes o' two continents.
<6>Once you reach the rocks, it's time to let the bottomless pot go for a lil' swim<--->splish-splash.
<6>Goddess willin' whoever picks this up is pure o' heart.
{LEADER} wonders what age Ed was when he wrote this. It's tidy enough handwriting...for a child.
